title: Elon Musk Promises Tesla Owners Will Soon Honk With Farts And Goat Bleat Sound
text:
Teslas recently began installing pedestrian noisemakers in its vehicles, which emit a sound when the car is moving below 30km/h.

And while talking about them yesterday, CEO Elon Musk joked that owners would soon be able to choose the sounds for noisemakers and horns.

Images courtesy: Reuters

"Customized horn & movement sounds (coconuts being one, of course) coming to Teslas soon," Musk posted on Twitter on September 6. If you're confused by the coconuts, they're a reference to the classic comedy film, 'Monty Python and the Holy Grail', one Musk has admitted to being a fan of before. In it, as protagonist King Arthur is introduced to the sounds of clopping horse hooves, it turns out instead he's actually pretending to gallop along on a horse, while his squire claps coconut shells together.

💨 & 🐐 sounds too (also, of course) — Elon Musk (@elonmusk) 6 October 2019

Don't Miss 540 SHARES 137 SHARES 199 SHARES

Additionally, Musk responded to the tweet saying owners would also have fart and goat noises available to them. The latter is actually a reference to Tesla's 'Toilet Humour Mode', which allows owners to have their car emit sounds of flatulence when signalling a turn.

Other users suggested jungle and rainforest sounds, which Musk seemed to take under consideration, as well as custom recorded audio files. And you know for sure there will be at least a few people that take that excuse to record something incredibly distasteful, or them yelling out a curse word.

The noisemakers for electric vehicles have been added just ahead of new regulation coming out from the US' central transportation board. These are expected to save an estimated 2,400 people in the US from injuries each year. After all, electric cars are insanely quiet, and at under 30 km/h you may not ever hear them coming at you from behind.

And that’s just the tip of the iceberg https://t.co/cgRKiDsdbK — Elon Musk (@elonmusk) 7 October 2019

Given Musk's past record on Twitter though, it's not surprising at all he took it as an opportunity to make fart jokes.
